item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Has a Perfect Opportunity to Include Its Own Soulslike NPC Summons
item.description:
The silent vigil until Hollow Knight: Silksong news drops continues, although mounting evidence suggests it won't last much longer. Fans have been waiting since February 2019 for the game to come out, and the last major news drop came in June 2022, so any signs of life the community can find are cause for alarm. A recent Steam update, followed by Hollow Knight: Silksong 's Xbox store page finally going up, points to more news in the near future, so unaffiliated internet users should expect Silksong 's persistent social media trends to return in full force throughout the summer news season.

Hollow Knight ’s original 2017 release is what’s inspired a lot of this enduring loyalty, as few indie Metroidvanias can compete with everything it got right. The idea that Hollow Knight: Silksong will introduce fresh ideas to its predecessor’s strong foundation that are held to the same standards has kept that loyalty strong, even if fans have been waiting years for another sample of Silksong ’s parts in motion. Five years and multiple genre competitors later, it will be fascinating to see how Hollow Knight: Silksong handles its own blend of action, platforming, exploration, and challenge, especially since the original game did leave some room to improve.

Hollow Knight Struggled To Convey Allies Through Gameplay

On top of being a Metroidvania, Hollow Knight incorporated several Soulslike elements into its mechanics and world. Apart from obvious staples like dropping currency on death and navigating a somber post-apocalyptic kingdom, Hollow Knight also works its NPCs’ fates directly into its quest design. Who lives, dies, or accomplishes their goals can depend on the player’s actions, and a lot of small interactions across the game build up into a surprisingly immersive experience. Silksong is expected to expand NPC interactions further into this by giving its protagonist, Hornet, dialogue during conversations, but it should also hone another aspect of Souls NPCs.

Battle Partners In Hollow Knight Were Underwhelming

Very rarely, Hollow Knight ’s friendly NPCs accompany the player in battle. One instance sees Cloth helping against the Traitor Lord, while another involves Quirrel interrupting the Uumuu fight. Cloth offers a compelling take on Siegmeyer’s classic Dark Souls quest that involves helping her before she returns the favor, but Quirrel’s role is less impactful. Despite meeting the player frequently, Hollow Knight ’s enigmatic Quirrel is limited to cracking Uumuu’s defenses instead of acting as an AI helper like Cloth.

It's a shame that Hollow Knight ’s lone helper NPC is missable content, and her fellow helper candidate was relegated to a frustrating mechanic, but Hollow Knight: Silksong could learn from their failings.

Hollow Knight: Silksong Is A Better Fit For NPC Partners

The key to Hollow Knight: Silksong improving its NPC summons is Hornet’s ability to share dialogue with NPCs. If Hornet is able to befriend a battle-ready character, she can then summon them before boss fights. Something like a combination of Lies of P ’s Specters and Dark Souls ’ summoning could be at play here, with the summon only appearing inside the boss arena while imposing a limitation like reduced resources or locked Tools. Developer Team Cherry could even delay summoning prompts until after bosses are discovered to ensure players will always have at least one normal fight with them.

Summoned NPCs Could Bring Silksong's World Together

Summons will help struggling players see Hollow Knight: Silksong ’s story through to the end and should do so better than the inferior follower Charms of the first Hollow Knight . However, more than just adding an accessibility feature, recruiting NPCs will encourage players to become more invested in Hollow Knight: Silksong ’s setting and cast via attached side quests.

Also, designing a battle moveset for summons is a good justification for making optional bosses out of them as well. By reinforcing Hornet’s connections with the people of Pharloom, Hollow Knight: Silksong could turn this standard Souls mechanic into another piece of its intricate tapestry.

item.title: Ultimate Golf Promo Codes (June 2024)
item.description:
There are many golf fans around the world, but this is a rather expensive hobby, so it is not available to everyone. Fortunately, game developers understand this very well, and that's why you can play Ultimate Golf on your phone. Like many other mobile games, you can unlock and upgrade your equipment. Luckily, you can redeem Ultimate Golf codes to get some equipment for free.

Updated June 6, 2024, by Artur Novichenko: The Ultimate Golf developers have just released a batch of new codes. We've updated this guide to include them, so use them as soon as possible and claim your rewards.

Ultimate Golf: All Codes

Although there are few active codes presently, they will give you a good start in Ultimate Golf . By redeeming one of the codes, you will receive a Gold Bag with a high chance of having an epic club, as well as many balls and pins. Below you will find a list of all active codes, but redeem them as soon as possible because they are expiring rapidly.

Active Codes (June 2024)

  • zach8 - Enter this code to get a Golf Bag. (NEW)
  • welcome0422 - Enter this code to get a Golf Bag. (NEW)
  • Player1 - Enter this code to get some Golf Pins.

Expired Codes (June 2024)

  • PALMER24
  • TOMCAT
  • TEEREX
  • BIGEASY
  • THEDON
  • HAPPY
  • BOB
  • CHUBBS
  • SHOOTER
  • Cooper
  • welcome0422
  • jared23
  • erelic23
  • zach8
  • THEBEAST23
  • ZACH22
  • BOOSTME
  • ZENDO77
  • YAY10K
  • Full18
  • Blossom23
  • Lemonade18
  • Marv31
  • SEZAZD3X
  • SWING

Ultimate Golf: How to Redeem Codes

Many mobile game developers add the option of redeeming codes to attract interest in their projects. To make it easy for players to find this option, it is usually located in the profile menu. In Ultimate Golf , it's easy to redeem codes, but you won't find them in the profile menu, so you'll have to spend some time exploring the game's HUD. To help you with this, we have created a guide that will show you how to redeem codes in Ultimate Golf .

  • Launch Ultimate Golf .
  • Finish the tutorial and go to the Home tab in the main menu of the game.
  • Under the Play Golf button, you will see a bright orange Free Rewards button. Press it.
  • At the bottom of the screen, you will see the Promo Code. Press Enter to the right of this inscription.
  • A new window will open with a code field. You can either manually enter the code there, or copy it from our list of active codes and click the Paste button below the field.
  • Then press Submit to redeem the code.

How to Get More Ultimate Golf Codes

Sometimes the newest codes are challenging to find and players have to spend a lot of time searching for good sources of information. If you want to be the first to receive new promo codes, you should bookmark this page because we update it monthly. If you are interested in official information from the developers, you can visit Ultimate Golf! page in X. There, you will find not only active promo codes but also information about various updates and events.

Ultimate Golf is available on mobile.

item.title: Genshin Impact Video Leak Shows Emilie's Synergy With Dehya
item.description:
Highlights

  • Emilie is a new Dendro user in Genshin Impact rumored to be a five-star unit with a polearm weapon focusing on the Burning reaction.
  • Emilie's leaked kit details suggest she will have synergy with Pyro user Dehya, enhancing DPS potential and excelling in Burning comps.
  • Players should use Emilie with caution in team compositions revolving around the Quicken reaction, as her damage may be reduced.

A new Genshin Impact leak has revealed how well the new character Emilie performs when placed in a team composition that revolves around the Burning reaction. Genshin Impact 's social media accounts have officially announced Emilie for the upcoming Version 4.8.

Emilie's official splash art has confirmed that she will be a new Dendro user, and she's rumored to use the polearm as her weapon of choice. While the official introduction did not reveal her rarity, recent Genshin Impact rumors revealed that Emilie will be a five-star unit, making her the first five-star to have this weapon and element combination.

A new Genshin Impact leak has revealed an interesting video showing in-game footage, featuring the upcoming five-star character Emilie in the same party as the popular Pyro user Dehya. Emilie's recently leaked kit details suggest that her playstyle primarily revolves around the Burning elemental reaction, which is unusual for Dendro users. Burning is one of the oldest elemental reactions in the game, and it can be triggered by combining Dendro and Pyro, dealing damage over time. The kit details have also revealed that players should probably avoid using Emilie in team compositions that revolve around the Quicken reaction, since her damage will be reduced against the target affected by this aura.

Genshin Impact Leak Reveals Emilie and Dehya Team Comp Footage

The leaked in-game footage proves that Emilie will have great synergy with the somewhat forgotten Flame-Mane, Dehya. Many fans in the comment section praised HoYoverse for adding a new character that can enhance Dehya's DPS potential. Even though there was a lot of hype around the Pyro user's release back in 2023, her kit turned out to be underwhelming and unfitting for a lot of standard team compositions. Many suspect that this is the main reason why HoYoverse decided to include Dehya in the less popular Standard Character Banner.

While some comments claim that Emilie would still be better off having a more powerful Genshin Impact DPS, others claim that Dehya is the perfect fit since her Pyro application is higher compared to other characters that use this element. The video also confirms that Emilie will be a powerful off-field support who can dish out tons of damage even when she leaves the field.

When it comes to the rest of the team, players can use two additional Pyro characters, but in that case, Emilie will have to do most of the heavy lifting when it comes to Dendro application. While Burning comps are Emilie's best fit, rumors suggest she could also be a decent choice for Genshin Impact teams relying on the Vaporize and Melt reactions.

item.title: Destiny 2: 7 Best Episode: Echoes Artifact Perks
item.description:
Highlights

  • Get ready for Destiny 2 Episode: Echoes with artifact perks like Elemental Charge for armor and Void Overshield.
  • Kinetic weapons now create elemental pickups matching your Super, making them more valuable for Prismatic builds.
  • Radiant Orbs grant weapon damage buff on Solar and Prismatic subclasses, a must-have for the day 1 raid race.

Destiny 2 has done away with seasons, replacing the system with Episodes now that The Final Shape expansion is out. The first Episode, Echoes, is set to start after the first week, but the artifact for the Episode is already out and players can level it—at least, its first part. The artifact is set to expand as the Episode goes on, most likely to keep things fresh now that players need to wait up to three months for another content update.

The first act of Episode: Echoes has quite a few artifact perks centered around Prismatic, the newest subclass. But there are also a few other interesting newcomers, such as a push for swords to be good DPS options. Here's a look at the top artifact perks for Episode: Echoes .

7 Authorized Mod: Elemental Charge

Gain An Energy Discount On Elemental Charge Mod

This simple artifact perk gives a nice discount to the Elemental Charge mod, which basically has a chance of granting players armor charge whenever they pick up an elemental pickup like Firesprite, Void Breach, etc.

With its cost now significantly reduced to only one energy slot, it could definitely see some uptime in a few Prismatic builds in particular that take advantage of elemental pickups. Not only would players gain Armor Charge, but they might also get a Void Overshield or Restoration depending on the build or subclass they are running. A nice two-for-one deal.

6 Elemental Siphon

Kinetic Final Blows Create Elemental Pickups Matching Super

Still on the topic of elemental pickups, Kinetic weapons might see more use this season thanks to this artifact perk alone. Now, takedown with Kinetic weapons will create elemental pickups that match the player's Super.

The wording might seem confusing, and that's because it's meant to work well with Prismatic, where players might be running a different element on their grenade and on their Super. With the new Facet of Grace fragment for Prismatic, this artifact perk is going to likely see some use.

5 Radiant Orbs

Orbs Grant Radiant On Solar And Prismatic Subclasses

Orbs of Power are common drops in the game and now, if players are on Solar or Prismatic, picking one up will grant them Radiant, which buffs their weapon damage by 25% in PVE for a few seconds.

This is extremely powerful, and a must-have for players who plan on spending a lot of time on Prismatic, but even on Solar, it removes the need to invest in a fragment that grants Radiant on melee. Anyone planning on hitting the day 1 raid race will probably grab this artifact perk for an easy damage boost on the go.

4 Argent Blade

Armor Charge Empowers Swords With Bonus Damage And Energy Charge Rate

Swords are on the menu right out of the gates for The Final Shape, and the artifact proves that. Not only do players get Overload Swords, but they also have Argent Blade. Armor Charge will empower sword strikes and energy charge rate, consuming a stack of charge when activated.

For endgame PVE, this could be a big change that puts swords in front of other damage options, depending on the boss type and the damage window. It will work perfectly with weapons like The Lament, and Fallen Guillotine, the latter being especially true with the next artifact perk that discusses Void damage sources.

3 Expanding Abyss

Void Damage Is Buffed Against Weakened Targets

Void weapons will be particularly efficient this season, provided that the target is weakened. As such, Expanding Abyss will be a crucial pickup for endgame PVE activities like raiding, and namely the day 1 race. With weaken being readily available, it's an easy way to deal even more damage.

Not to mention, there are so many great Void weapons available now thanks to Into the Light, with Edge Transit, Hammerhead, and Fallen Guillotine looking particularly promising. But also, some Exotic options like Deathbringer and Truth might see more use this season.

2 Transference

Charge Abilities Faster In Prismatic Transcendence & Refund Energy

The artifact also comes with a go-to Prismatic perk, Transference. While Transcendence in Prismatic already grants a very good ability recharge rate across the board, Transference will make it even better. Moreover, weapon final blows will refund some Dark and Light energy while Transcendent, which will make reaching it much faster.

This is no doubt one of the strongest perks this season, especially for players who plan on spending a lot of time playing Prismatic. It basically tunes the entire subclass and its features up to 200%.

1 Shieldcrush

Elemental Buffs Grant Melee & Grenade Recharge

Shieldcrush is another great ability spam-boosting perk. Woven Mail, Frost Armor, and Void Overshield will not only grant more damage resistance but also charge the player's melee faster. Meanwhile, Amplified and Radiant will charge the player's grenade faster.

This widens the scope of buildcrafting for Prismatic even more, as players stack multiple sources of ability regeneration. However, even outside of Prismatic, this perk will be immensely valuable, with Radiant being potentially excellent for bringing back the likes of Starfire Protocol for Warlocks.

item.title: The Rogue Prince of Persia: How to Free Shahin
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Find All the Mind Map Clues to Rescue Shahin
  • How to Open Shahin’s Cell Door in The Rogue Prince of Persia

The Rogue Prince of Persia uses death as a mechanic to unravel the main storyline. While you start with the goal of reaching the palace to stop the invading Huns and free your people, finding clues along the way will reveal that someone from the royal family has been captured. That person turns out to be your brother Shahin, who you must also find and free as quickly as possible.

Considering the rogue-lite nature of the game, rescuing Shahin will not be easy. His quest is designed to span across multiple runs, but each time you die, you come back stronger. Here are all the clues that will help you find Shahin's location, and how to open his cell doors in The Rogue Prince of Persia .

How to Find All the Mind Map Clues to Rescue Shahin

The Rogue Prince of Persia features a mechanic called a Mind Map similar to an evidence board used by detectives to solve cases. Every time you discover a clue, the Mind Map will update to track your progress by connecting different events.

During your early runs, the Mind Map will only hint that someone important was captured. Finding more clues will reveal that the person is your brother, Shahin; what happened to him, and where he is being kept as a prisoner.

You, however, do not need to find all the clues to complete Shahin's rescue quest in The Rogue Prince of Persia . You only need to unlock all the biomes to reach him. Some of the clues only exist to fill the Mind Map, so they do not need to be found in any specific order.

There is little sense in following the Mind Map to track your progress in The Rogue Prince of Persia . Since clues can be discovered in any order, you can discover where Shahin was taken before learning that the person captured is Shahin. This is something that may warrant fixing once the game is ready to leave early access.

The following is a list of all the clues you need to find to complete the Mind Map for Shahin. You can also just explore every nook and cranny of each biome to uncover all the clues.

The Hun War Camp Clue

During your first run, find and speak with Azadeh, the village chief, in Zagros Village. She can be found at the highest levels of the biome, so keep climbing until you find her.

Speaking with Azadeh will unlock the Hun War Camp, which can only be accessed from the Oasis. Head over there in the next run and keep exploring until you come across a large table with an exclamation mark. There will be a note on the table that talks about capturing someone important in the Grand Academy. Reading the note will unlock the Grand Academy and start your quest to rescue Shahin in The Rogue Prince of Persia .

Do not forget to find the equipment chest to unlock the Whirling Spear in The Rogue Prince of Persia . It is a tier-A weapon that does a lot of damage in the right hands.

The Grand Academy Clue

The next clue can be found in the Grand Academy, which can be accessed through the Zargos Village. Enter every golden door (doors with light streaming out of them) in the Academy until you find a room with a lot of scrolls and documents.

There will be a torn fabric on the table that belongs to Shahin. You now finally know that the person captured is your brother. Interact with it to update your Mind Map and complete the biome to face General Berude in the Outer Ramparts.

The Grand Academy could prove to be challenging. Make sure to increase your maximum health to stand a chance.

The Ruined Aqueduct Clue

On your next subsequent run, head to the Ruined Aqueduct instead of the Grand Academy. Explore the lower levels of the Aqueduct to discover a deep shaft alongside a red chain. There is nothing more to do here for now, but remember this location because you will need to return here later.

You can also find the Prince's mother on one of the lower levels of the Ruined Aqueduct. She is another node on the Mind Map that can be updated to unlock an achievement in The Rogue Prince of Persia .

The Ruined Aqueduct also has a blacksmith who upgrades your weapon for gold . Find him at the lower levels as well.

The General Berude Clue

Beating General Berude in The Rogue Prince of Persia reveals the location of Shahin if you have found the previous clues. She will mention that Shahin is being kept inside the Tower of Oblivion, which is the next biome you enter after the Outer Ramparts.

General Berude's dialogues change depending on how many times you have faced her and what clues you have found prior.

The Tower of Oblivion Clue

Shahin can be found in a prison cell at the end of the Tower of Oblivion, which is longer than any of the previous biomes in The Rogue Prince of Persia . While the game randomizes each level, you have a higher chance of finding Shahin by following the lower paths on the left side. If you spot a hallway with a series of cell doors right after unlocking a Well of Dreams, you are on the right path.

When you finally find Shahin, speak with him to mark the end of the run. There is nothing else to do here except jump on the platform above and head into the door to find your next clue. The notebook on the desk will reveal that the only way to free Shahin from his cell in The Rogue Prince of Persia is to speak with Azadeh.

How to Open Shahin’s Cell Door in The Rogue Prince of Persia

It is finally time to free Shahin in The Rogue Prince of Persia . However, note that all the following events need to be completed within the same run .

  • Start a new run and speak with Azadeh in the Zagros Village to get a lever.
  • Return to the shaft in the Ruined Aqueduct and use the lever to release the water.
  • Head on to beat General Berude, and enter the Tower of Oblivion.
  • Reach Shahin again and jump to the platform above to pull the lever. This will open the cell doors to free Shahin in The Rogue Prince of Persia .

With Shahin finally free, speak with him to complete the quest. You can continue to explore the Tower of Oblivion to farm more Spirit Glimmer and make more headway. However, if you want to find Shahin again, you need to return to the Oasis. He will be waiting beside your tent.
